main event: Four circular, glowing blue objects were sighted over Karachi, Pakistan on December 12, 1952. The objects were reported to have made high-speed dives and caused watch dials to stop.
interesting points: The objects were observed by multiple witnesses over a period of 5-10 minutes.
The objects approached from the southeast, traveled at high altitude, and maintained a constant elevation.
Officials from the Pakistani government had conflicting reports about whether the objects were photographed by the Karachi Meteorological Office.
There were suggestions that the reports of the sightings may have been used for propaganda purposes.
The U.S. Air Force investigated the sightings and suggested that the objects could have been high-altitude military aircraft.
witnesses: multiple observers, including military and civilian
